title: Correlative X-ray Microanalysis of a Boron Steel Sample Using Micro-XRF and SEM-EDS
content: Micro X-ray Fluorescence (Micro-XRF) and Scanning Electron Microscope-based Energy Dispersive Spectroscopy (SEM-EDS) are similar X-ray microanalysis techniques in that they both employ characteristic X-rays emitted from the sample to conduct qualitative, quantitative analysis, line scan, and mapping analyses. For Micro-XRF, fluorescent X-rays are excited by high-energy X-rays emitted from the X-ray tube, while SEM-EDS utilizes X-rays generated after electron beam-sample interaction. Modern Micro-XRF and EDS systems use Silicon Drift Detectors (SDDs) for X-ray detection.
